config.easierworldcreator.features_chunk: Set the chunk radius for feature access. Default: 1. Recommended: 2â€“3. Higher values increase RAM usage and generation time but allow larger features, avoid changing value for existing worlds
config.ewc.wanna_quit: Are you sure you want to quit? Changes will not be saved
config.ewc.restart_message: You made some changes that requires your game to restart. Click on RESTART to restart your game
config.ewc.info: get more info on the option
config.ewc.multi_chunk.concept:
When Minecraft generates a chunk, it goes through several steps. One important step is feature generation, where elements like plants, grass, trees, ores, and other natural structures are added to the terrain.

By default, each feature is generated within a limit of 3x3 chunks at most, centered around the chunk currently being generated. This ensures that the features fit within this area, keeping the generation process consistent and smooth.

However, in some cases, this 3x3 chunk limit is not sufficient. For example, larger or more complex structures might need to span multiple chunks in a synchronized way. To address this, multi-chunk features are used.

Multi-chunk features allow the game to save the information about these larger structures. Once all the necessary chunks for the feature have been generated, the entire structure can be placed properly, avoiding missing parts or inconsistencies in the world.

 Desactivation of this option will not generate features larger superior to 3x3. Since that Vanilla features are always smaller thant this area, no problem should appear. For a better immersion, it is recommended to keep this config to true
config.ewc.multi_chunk.comparison: Comparison between option activate and not, using
